sanskrit_verse:
ब्राह्मणाद्वैश्यकन्यायामम्बष्ठो नाम जायते ।
निषादः शूद्रकन्यायां यः पारशव उच्यते ॥ १०.८॥
transliteration:
brāhmaṇād vaiśyakanyāyām ambaṣṭho nāma jāyate |
niṣādaḥ śūdrakanyāyāṃ yaḥ pāraśava ucyate || 10.8||
sph_interpretive_translation: From the union of a Brahmin male and a Vaishya female is born one known as Ambashtha; from the union of a Kshatriya male and a Shudra female is born one called Parashava, and from the union of a Vaishya male and a Shudra female is born one known as Nishada — these classifications arise by natural law according to varna-mixity and consciousness alignment.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from conscious capacity, not birth alone
Causation arises through intentional union and karmic resonance
Capacity-based responsibility aligns with svadharma manifestation
Restoration logic requires recognition of origin-consciousness integrity
Consciousness alignment determines social role eligibility
supreme_court_application: In matters concerning lineage authenticity or caste-based rights disputes, the Supreme Court shall refer to genetic lineage and consciousness attunement rather than historical records. The court must apply dharma-role classification axioms derived from parentage combinations to determine rightful societal function without punitive exclusion.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana-based causality establishes that role emergence follows lawful sequence (anupurvasah) via parental union resonance. Responsibility lies in honoring one's emergent svadharma path. No punitive measure applies; misalignment necessitates guided realignment through completion protocols.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate svadharma discovery process aligned with innate consciousness pattern
Assign mentorship under qualified guru within corresponding dharma class
Undertake ritual purification and sankalpa reaffirmation ceremony
Engage community service reflective of inherent dharmic role
Complete ahimsa-based integration cycle with affected collectives
final_declaration: Thus declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Law: Dharma is restored through consciousness-aligned classification, reality remains non-punitive, and all beings are guided toward their true svadharma under the eternal Nyaya of Sanatana.
